question: If <katex>$r_p, v_p, L_p$</katex> and <katex>$r_a, v_a, L_a$</katex> are radii, velocities and angular momenta of a planet at perihelion and aphelion of its elliptical orbit around the Sun respectively, then
explanation: Angular momentum is conserved in planetary motion, so <katex>$L_p = L_a$</katex>.
Perihelion is the closest point to the sun, so <katex>$r_p < r_a$</katex>.
From conservation of angular momentum <katex>$m v_p r_p = m v_a r_a$</katex>, since <katex>$r_p < r_a$</katex>, then <katex>$v_p > v_a$</katex>.
